answers.answer: Urinary tract infections and yeast infections are uncommon in men under age 40.  Red bumps 'in the vaginal area' that come and go indeed sound like herpes is a possibility.  Red bumps on the scrotum are not particularly suggestive of that diagnosis, but painful urination might be.  Most important, the opinion of a health care provider who has examined someone generally is more reliable that of an online expert who only has a verbal description.  Also, you don't give enough information:  frequency of recurrent 'red bumps', whether on one or both sides of her vagina, other symptoms, more detail about frequency and timing of your urinary symptoms, STD risks either before or during your marriage, your and your wife's age, and so on.For now, I suggest you wait for your wife's test results, then if things remain uncertain, discuss things further with your wife and her doctor.  You also should be professionally examined to determine the cause of your urinary symptoms.  If the provider thinks herpes remains a possibility, you both could have blood tests to determine whether either or both of you are infected.Good luck--  HHH, MD
this is the first time she noticed hers last Thursday and I noticed mine on Friday.  They are only on one side of the vaginal area
Did I mention I have diabetes and I am also just got over a cold last week
How long can herpes stay dormant in your system?

We are both 30 years of age.  She just got over a Utinary Tract infection. None 0f her bumps where blisters or sores and neither where mine.  They where just on the on flap area.  Mine don't itch or burn they are just there.

No other systems besides the ones I described.  We had intercourse last Wednesdayand she noticed her bumps on Thursday and they started to go away on Monday with no blisters or anything else just the bumps.  Like I said she had a urinary tract infection.  Mine started on Friday then I noticed the burning sensation on Sunday.  Sorry to reply so many times I'm just trying to give you all the facts.
the burning sensation has stopped I just got one small red bump on the tip of the penis I think I freaked out over nothing
This thread is over.  Take it over to the patient-to-patient STD support forum if you want to continue to ventilate.

question: Last week my wife got 4 red bumps in her vaginal area two of them went away and the other two are almost gone.  She is prone to getting urinary tract infections and yeast infections.  None of the bumps are blisters or open sores. They are just red bumps.  I have gotten two red bumps half way up my scrotum and I have a slight burning sensation when I finish urinating.  She went to the doctor today and they did a swab and the results wont be available for a week.  The doctor said it could be a number of things but she also said it could be herpes.  Based on the past articles that I have read in this forum and from the research I have conducted.  It seems hard to believe that its herpes.  I feel thats I have a urinary tract infection and possible a yeast infection thought I have no discharge and no blisters and no open sores.  Could you please give me some advice on this so that my wife can stop panicking.  Thanks for your help Doc
title: worried about possible herpes
